remarks: The product rule for derivatives at a point.  For the (more general) relation version, see ~ dvmulbr .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 10-Feb-2015.)
statement:
dvadd.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvadd.x $e |- ( ph -> X C_ S ) $.
dvadd.g $e |- ( ph -> G : Y --> CC ) $.
dvadd.y $e |- ( ph -> Y C_ S ) $.
dvadd.s $e |- ( ph -> S e. { RR , CC } ) $.
dvadd.df $e |- ( ph -> C e. dom ( S _D F ) ) $.
dvadd.dg $e |- ( ph -> C e. dom ( S _D G ) ) $.
dvmul $p |- ( ph -> ( ( S _D ( F oF x. G ) ) ` C ) = ( ( ( ( S _D F ) ` C ) x. ( G ` C ) ) + ( ( ( S _D G ) ` C ) x. ( F ` C ) ) ) ) $.
